intro: Synthyris cymopteroides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved synthyris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, low-growing habit. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Synthyris cymopteroides is often found in open woodlands and sagebrush steppe environments.
